page.title: 01COSHESTON AREA- INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area covered includes part of the River Cleddau in South Pembrokeshire, Dyfed,Wales and land to the south of the river taking in Cosheston village, part of Upton Parish,the hamlet of Lower Nash, the eastern edge of the town of Pembroke Dock and the northen tip of the town of Pembroke. Also included is a tiny part of Burton village north of the Cleddau. Most of the block is farming land apart from Cosheston village and the borders of the towns. Part of the block is in the Pembrokeshire National Park. The block contains information on the following:-the River Cleddau, land features,farming,wildlife,housing, shopping,employment,industry,old industries,transport and treasure in the area; a childs day,a housewifes day,a family Sunday,churches,lifestyle and a credits page.
